DataElement.preferredName: CARS 1 How Much Time Spent Thinking About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much time they spent thinking about the possibility that their breast cancer could recur, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concerns About Recurrence Scale How Much Time Spent Thinking About Possibility of Breast Cancer Recurrence Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence._A question about how much time an individual spends thinking about the possibility that their breast cancer could recur._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

Concepts.definition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Thought Likert Scale Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of thought that ranges from 1: I don't think about it at all to 6: I think about it all the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subjective scoring of thought that ranges from 1: I don't think about it at all to 6: I think about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subjective scoring of thought that ranges from 1: I don't think about it at all to 6: I think about it all the time.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
